SAE.pageTitle: What you'll need to make a claim - Specialist equipment
SAE.h1: What you'll need to send a claim
SAE.paragraph1: You can claim for more than one piece of specialist equipment.
SAE.insetText: The person or company who needs paying back could be anyone who paid for your equipment. This includes yourself, a friend, a family member, your employer or the company who provided the equipment.

ul.li1: tell us the date you purchased the equipment - you can find this on the receipt or invoice
ul.li2: send us an invoice or receipt for the equipment you're claiming for
ul.li3: tell us details of the person or company who needs paying back, including bank details if we've not paid them before

SW.pageTitle: What you'll need to make a claim - Support worker
SW.h1: What you'll need to send your claim
SW.paragraph1: You'll need to send a claim for each type of support you get. For example, if you use a British Sign Language interpreter and have a driver, you'll need to send 2 claims.
SW.paragraph2: If different people or companies paid for your support, you'll also need to send separate claims for each.

ul.li2: to tell us how many hours of support you had on each date
ul.li3: the name and email address of the person or company who we can ask to confirm the support you're claiming for
ul.li4: the details of the person or company who needs paying, including bank details if we've not paid them before

SW.paragraph3: The person or company who needs paying back could be anyone who paid for your support worker costs. This includes yourself, a friend, a family member, or your employer.
SW.paragraph4: You'll need to send us an invoice or receipt for any support worker costs you're claiming for.
SW.h2: If you are self-employed or work at the same organisation as the person providing the support
SW.paragraph5: You'll need to send us a digital copy of a signed timesheet or payslip for the person who provided your support.

TTW.pageTitle: What you'll need to make a claim - Travel to work
TTW.h1: What you will need to make a claim
TTW.h1-body: You will need to tell us:

li1.1: dates that you travelled to or from work
li1.2: the details of the person or company we need to pay - this could be you, a family member or friend, your employer or a transport company

TTW.paragraph1: If you want us to pay a person or company we have not paid before, you'll need to give their name, address, email and bank details.
TTW.paragraph2: You will need the name and email address of a workplace contact we can ask to confirm each journey you are claiming for. This needs to be someone like your line manager or HR manager.

AV.pageTitle: What you'll need to make a claim - Adaptation to vehicle
AV.h1: What you’ll need to make a claim

ul.li1: tell us the date on the invoice
ul.li2: send us an invoice or receipt that shows the cost of the adaptation
ul.li3: tell us the details of the person or company we need to pay, including their bank details if we've not paid them before

AV.p1: You can claim for more than one adaptation in a single claim if the work was carried out by the same person or company.
AV.insetText: If different people or companies carried out the work you'll need to make a separate claim for each.

TiW.pageTitle: What you’ll need to make a claim - Travel in work
TiW.h1: What you’ll need to make a claim

ul.li1: the dates of each journey you took during work
ul.li2: the postcode of the place where each journey started and finished
ul.li3: the total cost of each journey you're claiming for
ul.li4: details of the person or company we need to pay, including bank details if we’ve not paid them before
ul.li5: a receipt or invoice that contains all the journeys you’re claiming for
ul.li6: separate receipts and invoices for each journey

TiW.insetText: The person or company we need to pay could be yourself, a family member or friend, your employer or a transport company.
TiW.p1: You also need to send us one of the following:
TiW.p2: You’ll need the name and email address of a workplace contact we can ask to confirm each journey you’re claiming for. This needs to be someone like your line manager or HR manager.
